text.div:
Generated Narrative: StructureDefinition EHDSObservation

NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
EHDSObservation 0..*EHDSDataSet
Elements defined in Ancestors:header, presentedForm
Observation model
Instances of this logical model can be the target of a Reference
header
status 1..1CodeableConceptStatus of the resource
Binding Description: (preferred): HL7 Observation status
observationDate[x] 1..1Clinically relevant time or time period for the observation
observationDateDateTimedateTime
observationDatePeriodPeriod
code 1..1CodeableConceptObservation code
Binding Description: (preferred): LOINC, NPU, SNOMED CT
originalName 0..1stringOriginal (conventional) name of the observation
method 0..1CodeableConceptObservation method
Binding Description: (preferred): SNOMED CT
order 0..1EHDSServiceRequestIdentifies order and order placer this observation belongs to
performer 0..1EHDSHealthProfessionalPerformer
anatomicLocation 0..1EHDSBodyStructureAnatomic location and laterality where the observation was performed.
result 0..1BaseResult of the observation including text, numeric and coded results of the measurement and measurement uncertainty. Content of the observation result will vary according to the type of the observation.
value[x] 1..1Observation result value according to the type of observation
Binding Description: (preferred): UCUM for units, SNOMED CT for coded results
valueStringstring
valueQuantityQuantity
valueRangeRange
valueCodeableConceptCodeableConcept
uncertainty 0..1BaseMeasurement uncertainty type and interval if needed.
dataAbsentReason 0..1CodeableConceptProvides a reason why the expected value in the element Observation.value[x] is missing.
Binding Description: (preferred): HL7 Data absent reason
referenceRange 0..*BaseReference range, multiple reference ranges of different types culd by provided. Provides guide for interpretation of result.
interpretation 0..*CodeableConceptInformation about reference intervals and result interpretation.
Binding Description: (preferred): SNOMED CT, HL7 ObservationInterpretation
resultDescription 0..1stringComments and narrative representation of the observation result and findings.
component 0..*BaseComponent in case the observation consists of multiple sub-observations (e.g. blood pressure).
result 0..1BaseResult of the observation including text, numeric and coded results of the measurement and measurement uncertainty. Content of the observation result will vary according to the type of the observation.
value[x] 1..1Observation result value according to the type of observation
valueStringstring
valueQuantityQuantity
valueRangeRange
valueCodeableConceptCodeableConcept
uncertainty 0..1BaseMeasurement uncertainty type and interval if needed.
dataAbsentReason 0..1CodeableConceptProvides a reason why the expected value in the element Observation.value[x] is missing.
Binding Description: (preferred): HL7 Data absent reason
referenceRange 0..*BaseReference range, multiple reference ranges of different types culd by provided. Provides guide for interpretation of result.
interpretation 0..*CodeableConceptInformation about reference intervals and result interpretation.
Binding Description: (preferred): SNOMED CT, HL7 ObservationInterpretation
derivedFrom[x] 0..*Reference to the related resource from which the observation has been made. For example, a calculated anion gap or a fetal measurement based on an ultrasound image.
derivedFromEHDSObservationEHDSObservation
derivedFromEHDSLaboratoryObservationEHDSLaboratoryObservation
derivedFromEHDSImagingStudyEHDSImagingStudy
triggeredBy[x] 0..*References to the observation(s) that triggered the performance of this observation.
triggeredByEHDSLaboratoryObservationEHDSLaboratoryObservation
triggeredByEHDSObservationEHDSObservation
hasMember[x] 0..*This observation is a group observation (e.g. a battery, a panel of tests, a set of vital sign measurements) that includes the target as a member of the group.
hasMemberEHDSLaboratoryObservationEHDSLaboratoryObservation
hasMemberEHDSObservationEHDSObservation

Documentation for this format

name: EHDSObservation
title: Observation model
description: EHDS refined base model for Observation information

element.short: Observation model
element.definition: EHDS refined base model for Observation information

element.short: Common header for all patient-related data
element.definition: Common header for all patient-related data

element.short: Subject
element.definition: Patient/subject information

element.short: Business identifier for the object
element.definition: Business identifier for the object

element.short: Authorship
element.definition: Resource authoring details

element.short: Author
element.definition: Author(s) by whom the resource was/were authored. Multiple authors could be provided.

element.short: Date and time of authoring/issuing
element.definition: Date and time of the issuing the document/resource by its author.

element.short: Date and time of the last update to the resource
element.definition: Date and time of the last update to the document/information

element.short: Status of the resource
element.definition: Status of the resource

element.short: Reason for the current status of the resource.
element.definition: Reason for the current status of the resource.

element.short: Language
element.definition: Language in which the resource is written. Language is expressed by the IETF language tag.

element.short: Version
element.definition: Business version of the resource.

element.short: A narrative easy-to-read representation of the full data set, e.g. PDF-version of a document
element.definition: A narrative easy-to-read representation of the full data set, e.g. PDF-version of a document

element.short: Clinically relevant time or time period for the observation
element.definition: Clinically relevant time or time period for the observation

element.short: Observation code
element.definition: Code representing the observation using the agreed code systems.

element.short: Original (conventional) name of the observation
element.definition: Original (conventional) name of the observation

element.short: Observation method
element.definition: Observation method (measurement principle) to obtain the result.

element.short: Identifies order and order placer this observation belongs to
element.definition: Identifies order and order placer this observation belongs to

element.short: Performer
element.definition: Performer

element.short: Anatomic location and laterality where the observation was performed.
element.definition: Anatomic location and laterality where the observation was performed.

element.short: Result of the observation including text, numeric and coded results of the measurement and measurement uncertainty. Content of the observation result will vary according to the type of the observation.
element.definition: Result of the observation including text, numeric and coded results of the measurement and measurement uncertainty. Content of the observation result will vary according to the type of the observation.

element.short: Observation result value according to the type of observation
element.definition: Observation result value according to the type of observation

element.short: Measurement uncertainty type and interval if needed.
element.definition: Measurement uncertainty type and interval if needed.

element.short: Provides a reason why the expected value in the element Observation.value[x] is missing.
element.definition: Provides a reason why the expected value in the element Observation.value[x] is missing.

element.short: Reference range, multiple reference ranges of different types culd by provided. Provides guide for interpretation of result.
element.definition: Reference range, multiple reference ranges of different types culd by provided. Provides guide for interpretation of result.
element.comment: Reference ranges are usually implied only for a numeric scale type. Use of the same units for reference range and value is implied.

element.definition: Information about reference intervals and result interpretation.

element.definition: This observation is a group observation (e.g. a battery, a panel of tests, a set of vital sign measurements) that includes the target as a member of the group.
